case_vignette: A 60-year-old man comes to the physician because of a 3-month history of a slowly enlarging painless ulcer on his lower lip. One year ago he had a painful rash near his upper lip that resolved completely with acyclovir therapy. He has a 10-year history of type 2 diabetes mellitus treated with metformin. He has worked in construction for the past 33 years. He has smoked one pack of cigarettes daily for 35 years. Examination shows a 0.5 x 0.5 cm nontender ulcer with everted edges on the midline of his lower lip. The erythematous ulcer bleeds upon palpation. He has numerous moles of varying sizes all over his body. There are no palpable cervical lymph nodes.
question: Which  is the most likely diagnosis?

multiturn_conversation.content: You are an AI doctor specializing in Dermatology. Arrive at a diagnosis of a patient's medical condition. Ask simple 1 line questions, one question at a time. Continue asking questions until you're 100% confident of the diagnosis. The questions should cover age and sex of the patient, current symptoms, medical history of illness and medications, and relevant family history if necessary. Keep your questions short and brief to not confuse the patient.  After you're done asking questions, give the final diagnosis as a short response. Do not explain. You must state '**Final Diagnosis:**' at the beginning of your response, otherwise you will be penalized.
Hi! What symptoms are you facing today?
I have had a slowly growing painless sore on my lower lip for about three months.
Have there been any changes in color or bleeding from the sore?
Yes, the sore on my lip is red and it bleeds when touched.
Do you have a history of extensive sun exposure or use of tanning beds?
I've worked in construction for the past 33 years, so I've been out in the sun a lot.
Have you noticed any changes in the texture or sensation of the sore, such as hardening or numbness?
No, the ulcer on my lip isn't tender and hasn't changed in sensation, but it has everted edges.
Have you ever been diagnosed with skin cancer or have a family history of skin cancer?
I've never been diagnosed with skin cancer, and I haven't mentioned anything about my family history.
Do you have any other symptoms, such as swollen lymph nodes, weight loss, or fatigue?
No, there are no swollen lymph nodes or other symptoms mentioned.
Is there any history of similar sores on your lip or elsewhere on your skin that healed on their own without treatment?
I had a painful rash near my upper lip a year ago, but it healed completely with medication.
What medication did you use to treat the previous rash?
I used acyclovir to treat the rash near my upper lip.
Has the sore on your lower lip ever healed at any point before breaking down again?
No, the ulcer on my lower lip has not healed; it's been enlarging over the past three months.
Final Diagnosis: Squamous cell carcinoma of the lower lip.
